sn56.62:4.1: Then the Buddha, picking up a little bit of dirt under his fingernail, addressed the mendicants:
sn56.62:4.2: “What do you think, mendicants? Which is more: the little bit of dirt under my fingernail, or this great earth?”
sn56.62:4.4: “Sir, the great earth is certainly more.
sn56.62:4.6: The little bit of dirt under your fingernail is tiny.
sn56.62:4.7: Compared to the great earth, it can’t be reckoned or compared, it’s not even a fraction.”
sn56.62:5.1: “In the same way, the sentient beings reborn in central countries are few,
sn56.62:5.2: while those reborn in the borderlands, among barbarian tribes, are many. …”
